title.english: The Day I Became a God

description:
Youta Narukami is a student focused only on his college entrance exams. During his last summer break of high school, he is approached by a girl named Hina who says she is the god of omniscience. She tells him that in thirty days, the world will end. At first Youta doesn't believe her, but after she demonstrates supernatural predictive abilities, he becomes convinced her power is genuine. Hina, meanwhile, decides for some reason to stay at his house, and they begin a tumultuous vacation facing the end of the world together.

(Source: Anime News Network)

Note: The first episode received an early screening on October 3rd, 2020. The regular TV broadcast started on October 11th, 2020.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Filmmaking
tags.description: Centers around the art of filmmaking.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Mahjong
tags.description: Centered around the game of mahjong.

tags.name: Baseball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of baseball.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Basketball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of basketball.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

node.description:
__Graduated:__ Chuukyou University (Department of Psychology)

__Introduction:__
Jun Maeda is a Japanese scriptwriter, lyricist, composer and music producer. He is known as one of the founding members of the software company Key, and he is the main composer and original creator for most of Key's visual novels. His most notable works are Kanon (Mai and Makoto routes), Air, Clannad, Angel Beats!, Tomoyo After, and Little Busters!. Maeda also worked on Summer Pockets, which he claimed "needed to make readers cry or it would mean the end for Key".

__Biography:__
Before forming Key, Maeda worked for the company Tactics where he had a hand in the creation of two games for that company: Moon and One: Kagayaku Kisetsu e.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/iktd13_)

Na-Ga is a male Japanese artist who is employed as a graphic designer and illustrator for the company Key known for such famous visual novels as Kanon, Air, and Clannad among others. Prior to working for Key, he was employed by the visual novel company Pearl Soft. Na-Ga has been working for Key since the production of Air as one of the computer graphic artists, but was able to majorly contribute to character design in Key's sixth visual novel Little Busters! with Itaru Hinoue, along with the later released Little Busters! Ecstasy and Kud Wafter. For Key's ninth title Rewrite, Na-Ga contributed to the game's computer graphics.

**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/haru0204)

__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Website](http://manyo-portal.info/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MANYO_arcane)

**Tomomi Teratani**, better known as Manyo, or alternatively known as Shinnyo Ryuuzouji, is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger and keyboardist, who specializes in background music and theme songs for console and PC games.

__[Website](http://yanaginagi.net/) | [Personal Twitter](https://twitter.com/yanaginagi) | [Professional Twitter](https://twitter.com/yanaginagi_info)__

__Introduction:__
yanaginagi, alternatively known as Gazelle, or otherwise simply known as nagi, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger under record label NBC Universal. She is known for performing as a guest singer for the band [supercell](https://anilist.co/staff/103913/supercell) under the name nagi from 2009-2011.

__Biography:__
During her childhood, she first became interested in music with the help of an electronic organ her mother received from the neighboring residents. She would go on to start composing music during Junior High School using DTM (Desktop Music) software her brother had bought.

In 2006, as a 19 year old, she would start making her indie debut by posting songs to the music site Player's Kingdom, where she would go on to produce many original songs. She has also posted songs to the video sharing site Nico Nico Douga under the name Gazelle, and participated as one of the singers in "Lantis Suite feat. Nico Nico Artists". During her stay at Nico Nico Douga, she would at one point come in contact with [ryo](https://anilist.co/staff/109941/ryo), the leader of supercell, which eventually led her to start working with him. A couple of years later in March 2008, she would retire from music activites on the site Nico Nico Douga.

On February 29, 2012, she would make her major debut by releasing the single "[Vidro Moyou](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7_iMfWt1hA8)" through Geneon Universal.

(Source: [Wikipedia](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%84%E3%81%AA%E3%81%8E%E3%81%AA%E3%81%8E), edited)

His most notable works are Kanon (Mai and Makoto routes), Air, Clannad, Angel Beats!, Tomoyo After, and Little Busters!. Key is a Japanese visual novel studio. It is known for making dramatic and plot-oriented visual novels. Some of their most famous works include CLANNAD, planetarian, and Little Busters!, among others. Several of their visual novels have received anime adaptations, making them quite well-known even outside of the visual novel community.

They've also formed Key Sounds Label for their music tracks, and they produced an Internet radio show called Key Net Radio which is now defunct as of 2010. Key works under the publishing company Visual Arts, where it originally sprung out of.

[Official Website](https://www.cliffordchapin.com/) l [Twitter](https://twitter.com/cliffordchapin)

Clifford Samuel Chapin IV is an American voice actor and director at Funimation.

Chapin is known for his roles in anime and video games, such as Ichijo Takayanagi from Red Data Girl, Connie Springer from Attack on Titan, Shingo Wakamoto from Prison School, Kukulkan in Smite, Hideyoshi Nagachika from Tokyo Ghoul, Yuri Dreyar from Fairy Tail, and Katsuki Bakugo from My Hero Academia. Chapin won the VNs Now award Best Male VA of 2013 for his role of David Sawicki in Yousei by Sakevisual. He also worked as a production assistant for Toddlers and Tiaras, NBC Nightly News, Disaster Guy, and The Rolling Girls. In 2014, Chapin landed the lead voice role of Raishin Akabane in Unbreakable Machine-Doll. In 2015, he voiced the lead character Harutora Tsuchimikado in Tokyo Ravens.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/caitlinsvoice) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/caitlinsvoice/) | [Myspace](https://myspace.com/caitlintiffany) | [Blog](https://kiristokyoto.livejournal.com/)

An American voice actor, voice director, and script writer for Funimation, New Generation Pictures, and Bang Zoom! Entertainment. She's been working in the anime industry since 2004. She grew up in the San Diego area, California, and has been married to Tony Patterson since 2009. Outside of voice acting, Caitlin has worked as an ESL teacher in Spain.
__Gender:__ Male

Kozue Kananiwa graduated from the HOSEI University of Tokyo, Faculty of Letters, Department of Japan Literature. Her first work as a producer was for [Oh! My Goddess](https://anilist.co/anime/50/Aa-Megamisama-TV/) in 2005.

Since, she participated in the production many renown series such as [Mahou Shoujo Madoka☆Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/Mahou-Shoujo-MadokaMagica/) in 2011, [Steins;Gate](https://anilist.co/anime/9253/SteinsGate) the same year, or more recently [Horimiya](https://anilist.co/anime/124080/Horimiya/).

Now, she is the General Manager of  both U-NEXT Anime & Book Division and of the Production Department.

(Source : Bangumi 番組計画RC3)
